div1.p: [Kelly] solicits corrections and clarifications for a new edition of his book, “Walter Reed and Yellow Fever.“

div1.head: Letter from [Howard A. Kelly] to the Superintendent of the Walter Reed Hospital, October 12, 1922
div1.opener:
October 12, 1922.
Thursday
The Superintendent of The Walter Reed Hospital,
Tacoma Park, Washington, D. C.
Dear Sir:
div1.p:
In revising my book, WALTER REED AND
YELLOW FEVER, for its third edition, I am very
anxious to have it as inclusive as possible.
I should, therefore, greatly appreciate your
giving me some information about any memorials
erected to Walter Reed.

Is The Walter Reed Hospital a memorial
hospital to General Reed and his work? If so,
when and in what way was it made a memorial to
him, and by what commission or committee was this
decided? What is the scope and extent of the
work of the Hospital? Has there been any memorial
erected to Reed at Panama?

These data will add greatly to the
interest in this work.
